# ctrlplane_deployment_variable_value (Resource)

Manages a deployment variable value override in Ctrlplane. A variable value provides a specific value for a deployment variable, optionally scoped to resources matching a selector expression.

When multiple values match a resource, the value with the highest `priority` takes precedence.

## Example Usage

### Literal Value

```terraform
resource "ctrlplane_deployment_variable_value" "literal_example" {
  deployment_id = ctrlplane_deployment.example.id
  variable_id   = ctrlplane_deployment_variable.example.id
  priority      = 1

  resource_selector = <<EOT
    resource.metadata["environment"] == "production"
  EOT

  literal_value = "my-production-value"
}
```

### Reference Value

```terraform
resource "ctrlplane_deployment_variable_value" "reference_example" {
  deployment_id = ctrlplane_deployment.example.id
  variable_id   = ctrlplane_deployment_variable.example.id
  priority      = 2

  resource_selector = <<EOT
    resource.kind == "kubernetes/cluster"
  EOT

  reference_value {
    reference = "key"
    path      = ["metadata", "cluster_name"]
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->

## Schema

### Required

- `deployment_id` (String) The deployment ID this variable value belongs to. Changing this forces creation of a new resource.
- `priority` (Number) The priority of the variable value. Higher priority values take precedence when multiple values match.
- `variable_id` (String) The deployment variable ID this value belongs to. Changing this forces creation of a new resource.

### Optional

- `literal_value` (Dynamic) A literal value (string, number, boolean, or object). Conflicts with `reference_value`.
- `resource_selector` (String) A CEL expression to select which resources this value applies to.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the deployment variable value.

### Blocks

#### reference_value

A reference value pointing to a property on the matched resource. Conflicts with `literal_value`.

- `reference` (String, Required) The reference key.
- `path` (List of String, Required) The path segments to the value in the referenced resource.

## Import

Import is supported using the value ID. Note that `deployment_id` and `variable_id` must be set in the configuration before importing.

```shell
terraform import ctrlplane_deployment_variable_value.example <value-id>
```
